p: After that, we measured the fluorescence anisotropy of the TAMRA-bR incorporated with lipid vesicles of increasing concentration to obtain the molar ratio of complete reconstitution. As shown in Figure 4, the value of fluorescence anisotropy was below 0.2 without lipid vesicles, considering the influence of existing surfactants. As we gradually increased the concentration of lipid vesicles, more TAMRA-bRs were incorporated into the vesicles, thus increasing the value of anisotropy, until all TARMA-bRs were incorporated into the vesicles when the ratio between proteins and lipids was larger than 4:3. We thus obtained the optimal concentration of bR to be 4 Î¼M and that of mimic membranes to be 3 mg/mL.
